Description: Large fragment from pottery mortarium, wavy outside wall, flat base. Light yellow clay, relatively dense. Graffito on inside of rim: ]ωπολλ[ retrograde.
Dimensions: Height: 13.40 centimetres ((original H of bowl 9.4 cm))
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p.61, pl. XXXII, no. 74)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 645, no. 35, pl. 19.1.10)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 55, Table 1, Nauk 67)
Villing 2006 / 'Drab Bowls' for Apollo: The Mortaria of Naukratis and Exchange in the Archaic Eastern Mediterranean (p.39 fig.21, no. 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (HA.05)
